item.description:
Event is open to all "sit inside" kayak types as well as canoes - No "sit-on-top" kayaks alowed due to reservoir restrictions

Bellamy Reservoir, fed by the Bellamy River together with Mallego Brook, covers 420 acres and provides 60% of the water supply for Portsmouth It was created in 1960 with a dam built by the Army Corps of Engineers. Bellamy Reservoir offers splendid small boating opportunities as well as great fishing.

Directions:
Take Rt. 155 to Town Hall Rd in Madbury. Follow road about 1 mile & take left onto Hayes Rd. Take right onto Nute Rd then go 1/2 mile & take right onto Hook Mill Rd. Becomes dirt & dead ends at water. Parking halfway down dirt section.

Sit-on-top kayaks are not allowed on reservoirs.

Life vests aka PFDs must be worn at all times while paddling with this group.

Directions using Google Maps to Bellamy Reservoir/Hook Mill Rd.
item.name: Bellamy Reservoir Paddle Madbury NH
